mojo.description: Generate a {@code build-info.properties} file based the content of the current {@link MavenProject}.

parameter.name: additionalProperties
parameter.description: Additional properties to store in the build-info.properties. Each entry is prefixed by {@code build.} in the generated build-info.properties.

parameter.name: outputFile
parameter.description: The location of the generated build-info.properties.

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: The Maven project.

mojo.description:
Display help information on spring-boot-maven-plugin.
Call mvn spring-boot:help -Ddetail=true -Dgoal=<goal-name> to display parameter details.

parameter.name: detail
parameter.description: If true, display all settable properties for each goal.

parameter.name: goal
parameter.description: The name of the goal for which to show help. If unspecified, all goals will be displayed.

parameter.name: indentSize
parameter.description: The number of spaces per indentation level, should be positive.

parameter.name: lineLength
parameter.description: The maximum length of a display line, should be positive.

mojo.description: Repackages existing JAR and WAR archives so that they can be executed from the command line using {@literal java -jar}. With layout=NONE can also be used simply to package a JAR with nested dependencies (and no main class, so not executable).

parameter.name: attach
parameter.description: Attach the repackaged archive to be installed into your local Maven repository or deployed to a remote repository. If no classifier has been configured, it will replace the normal jar. If a {@code classifier} has been configured such that the normal jar and the repackaged jar are different, it will be attached alongside the normal jar. When the property is set to {@code false}, the repackaged archive will not be installed or deployed.

parameter.name: classifier
parameter.description: Classifier to add to the repackaged archive. If not given, the main artifact will be replaced by the repackaged archive. If given, the classifier will also be used to determine the source archive to repackage: if an artifact with that classifier already exists, it will be used as source and replaced. If no such artifact exists, the main artifact will be used as source and the repackaged archive will be attached as a supplemental artifact with that classifier. Attaching the artifact allows to deploy it alongside to the original one, see the maven documentation for more details.

parameter.name: embeddedLaunchScript
parameter.description: The embedded launch script to prepend to the front of the jar if it is fully executable. If not specified the 'Spring Boot' default script will be used.

parameter.name: embeddedLaunchScriptProperties
parameter.description: Properties that should be expanded in the embedded launch script.

parameter.name: excludeDevtools
parameter.description: Exclude Spring Boot devtools from the repackaged archive.

parameter.name: excludeGroupIds
parameter.description: Comma separated list of groupId names to exclude (exact match).

parameter.name: excludes
parameter.description: Collection of artifact definitions to exclude. The {@link Exclude} element defines a {@code groupId} and {@code artifactId} mandatory properties and an optional {@code classifier} property.

parameter.name: executable
parameter.description:
Make a fully executable jar for *nix machines by prepending a launch script to the jar.

Currently, some tools do not accept this format so you may not always be able to use this technique. For example, {@code jar -xf} may silently fail to extract a jar or war that has been made fully-executable. It is recommended that you only enable this option if you intend to execute it directly, rather than running it with {@code java -jar} or deploying it to a servlet container.

parameter.name: finalName
parameter.description: Name of the generated archive.

parameter.name: includeSystemScope
parameter.description: Include system scoped dependencies.

parameter.name: includes
parameter.description: Collection of artifact definitions to include. The {@link Include} element defines a {@code groupId} and {@code artifactId} mandatory properties and an optional {@code classifier} property.

parameter.name: layout
parameter.description: The type of archive (which corresponds to how the dependencies are laid out inside it). Possible values are JAR, WAR, ZIP, DIR, NONE. Defaults to a guess based on the archive type.

parameter.name: layoutFactory
parameter.description: The layout factory that will be used to create the executable archive if no explicit layout is set. Alternative layouts implementations can be provided by 3rd parties.

parameter.name: mainClass
parameter.description: The name of the main class. If not specified the first compiled class found that contains a 'main' method will be used.

parameter.name: outputDirectory
parameter.description: Directory containing the generated archive.

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: The Maven project.

parameter.name: requiresUnpack
parameter.description: A list of the libraries that must be unpacked from fat jars in order to run. Specify each library as a {@code <dependency>} with a {@code <groupId>} and a {@code <artifactId>} and they will be unpacked at runtime.

parameter.name: skip
parameter.description: Skip the execution.

parameter.name: addResources
parameter.description: Add maven resources to the classpath directly, this allows live in-place editing of resources. Duplicate resources are removed from {@code target/classes} to prevent them to appear twice if {@code ClassLoader.getResources()} is called. Please consider adding {@code spring-boot-devtools} to your project instead as it provides this feature and many more.

parameter.name: agent
parameter.description: Path to agent jar. NOTE: the use of agents means that processes will be started by forking a new JVM.

parameter.name: arguments
parameter.description: Arguments that should be passed to the application. On command line use commas to separate multiple arguments.

parameter.name: classesDirectory
parameter.description: Directory containing the classes and resource files that should be packaged into the archive.

parameter.name: environmentVariables
parameter.description: List of Environment variables that should be associated with the forked process used to run the application. NOTE: the use of Environment variables means that processes will be started by forking a new JVM.

parameter.name: excludeGroupIds
parameter.description: Comma separated list of groupId names to exclude (exact match).

parameter.name: excludes
parameter.description: Collection of artifact definitions to exclude. The {@link Exclude} element defines a {@code groupId} and {@code artifactId} mandatory properties and an optional {@code classifier} property.

parameter.name: folders
parameter.description: Additional folders besides the classes directory that should be added to the classpath.

parameter.name: fork
parameter.description: Flag to indicate if the run processes should be forked. {@code fork} is automatically enabled if an agent, jvmArguments or working directory are specified, or if devtools is present.

parameter.name: includes
parameter.description: Collection of artifact definitions to include. The {@link Include} element defines a {@code groupId} and {@code artifactId} mandatory properties and an optional {@code classifier} property.

parameter.name: jvmArguments
parameter.description: JVM arguments that should be associated with the forked process used to run the application. On command line, make sure to wrap multiple values between quotes. NOTE: the use of JVM arguments means that processes will be started by forking a new JVM.

parameter.name: mainClass
parameter.description: The name of the main class. If not specified the first compiled class found that contains a 'main' method will be used.

parameter.name: noverify
parameter.description: Flag to say that the agent requires -noverify.

parameter.name: profiles
parameter.description: The spring profiles to activate. Convenience shortcut of specifying the 'spring.profiles.active' argument. On command line use commas to separate multiple profiles.

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: The Maven project.

parameter.name: skip
parameter.description: Skip the execution.

parameter.name: systemPropertyVariables
parameter.description: List of JVM system properties to pass to the process. NOTE: the use of system properties means that processes will be started by forking a new JVM.

parameter.name: useTestClasspath
parameter.description: Flag to include the test classpath when running.

parameter.name: workingDirectory
parameter.description: Current working directory to use for the application. If not specified, basedir will be used. NOTE: the use of working directory means that processes will be started by forking a new JVM.

mojo.description: Start a spring application. Contrary to the {@code run} goal, this does not block and allows other goal to operate on the application. This goal is typically used in integration test scenario where the application is started before a test suite and stopped after.

parameter.name: addResources
parameter.description: Add maven resources to the classpath directly, this allows live in-place editing of resources. Duplicate resources are removed from {@code target/classes} to prevent them to appear twice if {@code ClassLoader.getResources()} is called. Please consider adding {@code spring-boot-devtools} to your project instead as it provides this feature and many more.

parameter.name: agent
parameter.description: Path to agent jar. NOTE: the use of agents means that processes will be started by forking a new JVM.

parameter.name: arguments
parameter.description: Arguments that should be passed to the application. On command line use commas to separate multiple arguments.

parameter.name: classesDirectory
parameter.description: Directory containing the classes and resource files that should be packaged into the archive.

parameter.name: environmentVariables
parameter.description: List of Environment variables that should be associated with the forked process used to run the application. NOTE: the use of Environment variables means that processes will be started by forking a new JVM.

parameter.name: excludeGroupIds
parameter.description: Comma separated list of groupId names to exclude (exact match).

parameter.name: excludes
parameter.description: Collection of artifact definitions to exclude. The {@link Exclude} element defines a {@code groupId} and {@code artifactId} mandatory properties and an optional {@code classifier} property.

parameter.name: folders
parameter.description: Additional folders besides the classes directory that should be added to the classpath.

parameter.name: fork
parameter.description: Flag to indicate if the run processes should be forked. {@code fork} is automatically enabled if an agent, jvmArguments or working directory are specified, or if devtools is present.

parameter.name: includes
parameter.description: Collection of artifact definitions to include. The {@link Include} element defines a {@code groupId} and {@code artifactId} mandatory properties and an optional {@code classifier} property.

parameter.name: jmxName
parameter.description: The JMX name of the automatically deployed MBean managing the lifecycle of the spring application.

parameter.name: jmxPort
parameter.description: The port to use to expose the platform MBeanServer if the application needs to be forked.

parameter.name: jvmArguments
parameter.description: JVM arguments that should be associated with the forked process used to run the application. On command line, make sure to wrap multiple values between quotes. NOTE: the use of JVM arguments means that processes will be started by forking a new JVM.

parameter.name: mainClass
parameter.description: The name of the main class. If not specified the first compiled class found that contains a 'main' method will be used.

parameter.name: maxAttempts
parameter.description: The maximum number of attempts to check if the spring application is ready. Combined with the "wait" argument, this gives a global timeout value (30 sec by default)

parameter.name: noverify
parameter.description: Flag to say that the agent requires -noverify.

parameter.name: profiles
parameter.description: The spring profiles to activate. Convenience shortcut of specifying the 'spring.profiles.active' argument. On command line use commas to separate multiple profiles.

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: The Maven project.

parameter.name: skip
parameter.description: Skip the execution.

parameter.name: systemPropertyVariables
parameter.description: List of JVM system properties to pass to the process. NOTE: the use of system properties means that processes will be started by forking a new JVM.

parameter.name: useTestClasspath
parameter.description: Flag to include the test classpath when running.

parameter.name: wait
parameter.description: The number of milli-seconds to wait between each attempt to check if the spring application is ready.

parameter.name: workingDirectory
parameter.description: Current working directory to use for the application. If not specified, basedir will be used. NOTE: the use of working directory means that processes will be started by forking a new JVM.

mojo.description: Stop a spring application that has been started by the "start" goal. Typically invoked once a test suite has completed.

parameter.name: fork
parameter.description: Flag to indicate if process to stop was forked. By default, the value is inherited from the {@link MavenProject}. If it is set, it must match the value used to {@link StartMojo start} the process.

parameter.name: jmxName
parameter.description: The JMX name of the automatically deployed MBean managing the lifecycle of the application.

parameter.name: jmxPort
parameter.description: The port to use to lookup the platform MBeanServer if the application has been forked.

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: The Maven project.

parameter.name: skip
parameter.description: Skip the execution.
